questions.question_text:
NGFW mode allows policy-based configuration for most inspection rules.
Which security profile configuration does not change when you enable policy-based inspection?

discussion.content: D is correct , “Antivirus configuration is always profile-based, regardless of the NGFW mode selection”
B & C are correct - Infrastructure_Manual-6.2, p.327

questions.question_text: Which two statements about the firmware upgrade process on an active-active HA cluster are true? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The firmware image must be uploaded manually to each FortiGate.
choices.D: Only secondary FortiGate devices are rebooted.
choices.C: Traffic load balancing is temporarily disabled while the firmware is upgraded.
choices.B: Uninterruptable upgrade is enabled by default.

choices.C: Client > primary FortiGate > secondary FortiGate > web server
choices.B: Client > primary FortiGate > secondary FortiGate > primary FortiGate > web server
choices.A: Client > secondary FortiGate > primary FortiGate > web server

questions.question_text: In an HA cluster operating in active-active mode, which path is taken by the SYN packet of an HTTP session that is offloaded to a secondary FortiGate?
Which statement about the firewall policy authentication timeout is true?

discussion.content:
A sound as a correct answer - Secuity_Manual-6-2, p. 243.
B is wrong - no temporary firewall policy is removed

choices.D: It is a hard timeout. The FortiGate removes the temporary policy for a user's source MAC address after this timer has expired.
choices.C: It is an idle timeout. The FortiGate considers a user to be "idle" if it does not see any packets coming from the user's source MAC.
choices.B: It is a hard timeout. The FortiGate removes the temporary policy for a user's source IP address after this timer has expired.
choices.A: It is an idle timeout. The FortiGate considers a user to be "idle" if it does not see any packets coming from the user's source IP.

questions.question_text: Which two statements correctly describe how FortiGate performs route lookup, when searching for a suitable gateway? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Lookup is done on the last packet sent from the responder
choices.C: Lookup is done on every packet, regardless of direction
choices.A: Lookup is done on the first packet from the session originator
choices.D: Lookup is done on the first reply packet from the responder

discussion.content: A & D are correct - NSE7-Enretprise_FW-6.2, p. 132

Selected Answer: AD
A. and D.

For each session, FortiGate performs two route lookups: 
• For the first packet sent by the originator 
• For the first reply packet coming from the responder

Correct is A,D
FortiGate_Infrastructure 6.2 Study Guide page 10

Correct answer A, D
For any session, FortiGate performs a routing table lookup twice:
1) For the first packet sent by the originator
2) For the first reply packet coming from the responder
